1106856624487129088.text: /end ...  and the answer is segwit. Both LN and Sprites required a soft fork; rest is history. Scale -free topologies with any L2 system requires a lot of marketing and nodes to demonstrate feasibility, and that's where we're at.

1106854057413693440.text:
So what happened to the Sprites? Also authored at U. of Illinois, professor Andrew Miller, and otherwise known to twitter by socrates1024. That paper is in the link here: 

https://allquantor.at/blockchainbib/pdf/miller2017sprites.pdf …

1106850387720589312.text: Commercial implications might infer a handful of vendors competing against one another, with roughly the same number of nodes, each vendor connected with one another. It doesn't have to be that way. IMO L2 protocols should take these models into account and focus on hub seeding.

1106849701977038848.text: for anyone developing L2 protocols, the paper is well worth a read. I think it's also a good idea to use the term "scale-free" in lieu of "hubs". There's additional researching showing scale-free networks are more resistant to attacks relative to small-world networks.

1106848905931751424.text: Using the Flare routing protocol across both network models, in all cases you can see that simulated scale-free networks outperform the small world networks.pic.twitter.com/bSLwdhI5Jn

1106848079196704769.text: based on his simulation, "We also confirm that the Sprites protocol enjoys numerous advantages over the LN including smaller durations, shorter path length payments, and greater resiliency", in no small part due to Sprite's ability to incrementally fund the L1 contract.

1106847166075715585.text: Chris Cordi, the author, chose to model traffic using a dataset that "consists of six months (Dec 2016 – May 2017) of anonymized credit card transactions from a bank with between $10 and $50 billion in assets."  In the paper, avg purchases hover around the $50 mark.

1106846190795214848.text: The paper investigates two basic types of network topologies for L2, pictured below. When LN proponents talk about "hubs", they're talking about the scale free model. The WS model looks like we envision most P2P networks; lots of interconnections, few strongly connected hubspic.twitter.com/qX609JXxfW
